css: CSS is a graphic design language to define and create the presentation of a structured document written in a markup language
figma: Figma is a vector graphics editor and prototyping tool that is primarily web-based, with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications for macOS and Windows.
git: Git is version control software designed by Linus Torvalds, with the efficiency, reliability and compatibility of application versioning in mind when they have a large number of source code files.
html: HTML 5 is the fifth major revision of the basic language of the World Wide Web
js: JavaScript is an interpreted programming language, dialect of the ECMAScript standard. It is defined as object-oriented, prototype-based, imperative, loosely typed, and dynamic.
react: React is an open source Javascript library designed to create user interfaces with the aim of facilitating application development on a single page. It is maintained by Facebook and the free software community. There are more than a thousand free developers in the project.
vue: Vue.js is an open source JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single page applications.
graphql: GraphQL is an open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling queries with existing data.
svelte: Svelte is a free and open source Front End compiler created by Rich Harris and maintained by members of the Svelte core team.
